item.title: News24.com | WTO meeting on Covid-19 vaccine rights waiver went 'very well' - chair
item.description: The first World Trade Organisation meeting to discuss a draft agreement to temporarily waive intellectual property rights for Covid-19 vaccines went "very well", its chair said on Friday.

item.title: News24.com | Sri Lanka president declares state of emergency amid unrest
item.description: Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa Friday declared a state of emergency for the second time in five weeks, giving security forces sweeping powers as a nationwide strike demanding his resignation brought the country to standstill.

item.title: News24.com | Jailed ex-president of Georgia risks death: doctors
item.description: Georgia's jailed former president Mikheil Saakashvili whose health was weakened by a prolonged hunger strike risks death in the absence of adequate care, doctors said.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Sweden hasn't gone to war since Napoleon was alive, but Russia has it preparing for another one
item.description: "Security is really looked upon very differently today than just a couple of months ago," Sweden's ambassador to the US told Insider.

item.title: News24.com | Explosion in Madrid building injures 17 people
item.description: At least 17 people were injured, most of them lightly, in a strong explosion that rocked a four-storey building being renovated in central Madrid on Friday, Spanish authorities said.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Ukraine says Russia hasn't burned all its bridges with Ukraine — as it details demands for peace deal
item.description: Zelenskyy said Russian forces would have to return to where they were before the invasion for Ukraine to accept a peace deal.

item.title: News24.com | WATCH | War in Ukraine: watch all the latest videos as the conflict escalates
News24.com | Brazil's Bolsonaro calls Petrobras profits a 'rape'
item.description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro on Thursday urged state-run oil company Petrobras not to raise fuel prices again, and compared the company's profits to a "rape" of the country.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Mike Pence praises leaked Supreme Court draft opinion, says he prays Roe v. Wade will be overturned
item.description: Mike Pence asked the audience at a pro-life gala to pray for the Supreme Court justices behind the Roe draft to have the "courage" to follow through.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Belarus' dictator Lukashenko, seen as Putin's puppet, says 'unacceptable' for nukes to be used in Ukraine
item.description: Lukashenko, a dictator who relies heavily on Putin's support to remain in power, sounded rare notes of caution about Russia in a new interview.

item.title: News24.com | 'Bad boys' are back: India to reopen 100 coal mines as heatwave worsens power crisis
item.description: India is planning to reopen more than 100 coal mines previously considered financially unsustainable.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Surveillance footage shows the moment Russian rockets hit a Ukrainian amusement park
item.description: The footage published on Wednesday showed Soviet-developed GRAD rockets leveling rides, buildings, and park decor.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | PwC will shut its US and Mexico offices for two weeks a year to help consultants recharge
item.description: PwC's US and Mexico offices will close for a week in December and one week in July, Yolanda Seals-Coffield, deputy people leader, told Insider.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Elon Musk told investors he'd probably double or triple their money if they backed his Twitter buyout
item.description: Musk also said a return of five to ten times their investment wasn't out of the question if all went well, The New York Times reported.

item.title: News24.com | Nude video latest scandal turning Republicans against US Representative Cawthorn
item.description: A grainy 28-second video showing a naked young man gyrating against someone in bed amid squeals and laughter was the latest in a string of episodes that has turned Republicans against one of their own: the brash US Representative Madison Cawthorn of North Carolina.

item.title: News24.com | Queen Elizabeth will miss one of the royal highlights of the spring
item.description: Garden parties at Buckingham Palace are back, with one minor change.

item.title: News24.com | From lockdown to wedlock: Shanghai couple defy Covid woes to marry
item.description: A couple in Shanghai have beaten Covid lockdowns and bureaucracy to tie the knot, celebrating their marriage in the car park of their housing compound after a ceremony officiated via Zoom from the United States.

item.title: News24.com | Ukraine says UN-led Mariupol mission rescues 'almost 500 civilians'
item.description: Almost 500 civilians have been evacuated from the devastated city of Mariupol and its besieged Azovstal steel plant in a UN-led rescue operation, the Ukrainian president's office said on Friday.

item.title: News24.com | Israel launches manhunt after attack kills three
item.description: Israeli forces launched a manhunt on Friday for attackers who killed three people in the central city of Elad as the country marked the anniversary of its founding, in the latest incident of deadly violence.

item.title: Businessinsider.co.za | Louisiana lawmakers have advanced a bill that could lead to abortion patients being charged with murder
item.description: The bill, which grants constitutional rights to the unborn from the moment of fertilization, is set to move to the state's House floor for debate.
